Dzanek

I found a nice ship. Because of good RP crew was buying Gold Modes.
I played as Hua and for fun I haven't picked any skills until they're necessary.
I was giving some advices to Chun. I helped in research in 2 days because no waves of hunters had appeared. I managed to convince crew to rush CS instead of ASG. I wanted MA as second, but they made ASG, then MA, and Mycoscan.
Once I tried to take Pasiphae and collect scrap. I cooked a ration, ate getting dirty and got suspicion because I came to Alpha Bay 2 and noticed Terrence was outside in Pasiphae. Terrence, Janice and Roland blamed for it. To burn some AP, I helped with research. In Bravo Dorm I checked some people being there. Janice was there and I was wondering if she does her work. She had given me her bed earlier but instead of staying there, she came to Bravo Dorm, talking about RP, controlling NERON...
In day 2, I chitchatted with Andie because Derek and Roland wanted it, although I was at full morale, but they wanted, so I spammed with "Examine" and chitchatted. Andie never blamed me for it. I checked what Janice had done. She was Shrink, IT Expert, NERON's Only Friend, Diplomat. She told she'd buy Gold Mode if it was worth. I noticed she helped with CPU Overlocking. Counting, she relayed 4 times. On D1C8 she wanted to help with research, but when I came, she didn't relay them. She said she watered and treated all plants. Andie was in the Lab, and she came to Alpha Dorm. Janice helped with comms nicely and moved all bananas to Hydroponic Garden because we had Hydroponic Incubator. She came back to Alpha Dorm. She didn't seem to help with research. I said she had important skills and asked Chun if she wanted to hold her alive. Chun put her on suspect list, she said. I said about putting her at "sure" list if checked her movement. No information from her about PILGRED, so she wasn't wandering in rear part of Daedalus, right? Janice was nice talking and making us laugh. She didn't help with project because there was Plasma Shield and she was useless there, she wanted some research, but although the research came quickly, I saw no participation from her.
I checked the Bridge and radio. Knife was in storage. I checked AstroPad - Centre Alpha Storage was empty. I checked it. I knew Andie was human because of helping with research a lot, when I supposed Janice to convert the crew. I found a hidden Knife in CAS. I couldn't recall if Janice was wondering in Alpha Bay a lot. I got back to Alpha Dorm. I told about the knife the crew and Andie wanted me to hold this when I wanted Chun to hide this.
On day 3, I saw myself kicked off the bed. Janice kicked me because Terrence thought I was full of AP and I seemed passive to everything, doing nothing with hunters. Roland insulted me "If Hua was a pokemon, he would be a Snorlax, nothing doing just eating and sleeping". I got angry that they considered me useless. I could hold Janice alive, but when I should've lived with her kicking me off bed. Oh no... I checked CAS. Crew didn't take the Knife. I took it and got back to Alpha Dorm. Janice was there. I just waited until cycle change to kill her using the bed and the ration I held. I wanted to make sure that she did almost nothing. I see in logs no projects. Research advances seemed to be secret, so I checked Lab once more. Janice used apron and accessed research 2 times. I knew the Mycoscan had been done for a few cycles, but Janice accessed research just 2 times. I checked, everything was at 0%, so maybe Mycoscan was the only one, so she used 2-4 advances. Oh no... it's too few. I came back to Alpha Dorm. I checked Janice with Medikit, she was at full HP, but as Gold player I supposed her to have everything. Using cycle change, I killed her. First I checked in comrade bar, and saw 2 Mush bodies alive, so I thought I made a mistake but wait... Janice was Mush, she was Anonymush. I said Chun sorry for no talking about attempting to kill her, but I couldn't stand it. All her advances into project/research were just IT points used, no AP. Gardening was too few, 2 adult bananas.
I checked logs and after I killed Janice, I noticed they were defaced. I saw logs since D3C2, so the infect has happened there. I knew Andie was Mush because Janice chitchatted with Andie on D3C2, just after defacing. Chun didn't want to lose the only morale support, so she wanted RFS. I wanted the second Alpha Mush dead. I checked logs in Rear Corridor and Alpha Bay and noticed Terrence and Roland was wandering there on D3C1. I suspected Terrence because he was active on D3C2 and he wanted free bed. He wanted someone to kick me off because he supposed me to have full AP, so I supposed him to look at logs and notice deface. I was afraid that he could infect me on day change using Defacer, I knew he had 2 first skill near Mush selection and he's now Gold. I thought he was good but for me Mush or blind at logs human. I didn't suppose someone with Gold to be blind at logs, so I told Chun about it and Gioele killed him - human.
I knew Andie was Mush. She admitted to have 2 spores but I knew it. I shot some of hunters and exhausted went to sleep.
I supposed me punished by the Mush in the next day, maybe infected. I thought Janice could act alone and Roland didn't have to help her, considering him as possible human. But I'd got killed as Andie. I saw in logs some damage taken from showering, Andie infecting Hua under camera and MycoAlarm, and in chat Andie reported me because I killed Janice without any good reason. Yeah, I told in public that I killed Janice because she kicked me off the bed. Anyway, it was worth. I tried to convince Andie to make RFS for Raluca who was physicist and no technician had been there since Terrence was dead. Why Raluca? She made Spatial Wave Radio instead of Plasma Shield. I knew she was a newbie, but told Andie that we needed it for her, and told Chun to RFS Andie if done.
It was good crew, I enjoyed this ship that I spoiled their opportunity to keep gold on this "nice ship". Why did I start to suspect Janice? Because she bought this Gold so early and it interested me so much, the reason "why" she bought it.
Poor Roland is dead, and funny ship got Volcano zone. Derek, Chun and Gioele has died in the same time I got back to Mush as dead Andie. Tip for you: never hesitate to kill the Mush. I've got a reprimand from crew that I killed Janice without enough evidences, that I didn't watch her longer, but I made a mistake because I waited too long, 1 day too long, I allowed Janice to convert Andie, it was my mistake I hadn't killed Janice earlier.

On january 1, 2015
[7950824]

The fails are not all yours, at least not in my eyes, but counting fails is very hard to do.

See, there's not just one way to play the game, and not just one way to play it well. What could be a fail in strategy in one player's hands could be a success in another's.

You mentioned your article got 'deleted'; you didn't say cut short, so I'll mention that your character limit is pretty short for the endpage message - and based on your total glory ranking. If you died early, chances are high you only have enough space for about 1 sentence, two if you are economical with words.

Your described planet sounds nice indeed - and I personally don't care for forests as they have around a 2% chance to kill a player outright from a getting lost event followed by a found dead event.

The only advice I'd offer you for your future ships is that it's hard to over-communicate what is going on with your character. What you are doing, what goes wrong, when you will have time to fix problems like being dirty... all of that can be talked about and on most ships that can help you live a bit longer.

Unfortunately, quite a few of the ships end up being pretty cutthroat. Your fellow players in many cases are not all that experienced themselves - that person who failed to act sorry for killing a new player may not be much more than a newbie himself - and may not have recognized you as a new player. Some ships discuss players seen to finish the tutorial, but most of us are 'still learning', even though it's only a player's first ship once.

Your particular first ship had 3 other tutorial players on it. Andie appears to have been the player that actually killed you, though Gioele hit you at least once too. Hard to tell from an end page much of what was discussed on a ship, but the fact that Gioele and Andie appear to have worked together at least a little suggests some discussion between players about it and some people trying to work together, even if the goal they picked to accomplish wasn't the wisest course.

Keep having fun, and keep up the stories!
On january 1, 2015
Addem-Up

...Wait. Endgame character limits are based on Glory? That's the first I've ever heard of this. That's... not a good idea at all.
On january 1, 2015
NERON

As cold as it sounds, if you didn't explain to the crew that you didn't have AP to shower or even worse, not report dirty at all, that kill is perfectly justified. That really is suspicious and pretending to be n00bs is a legitimate mush tactic since the tutorial is resetable.

If you did explain the lack of AP to shower, then it's unfortunate but it's still somewhat suspicious given the other tasks you mentioned. As Impet found, there was some agreement among at least a portion of the crew, after all


You win some and you lose some. Mush is a PvP game, not a casual arcade game like most of MT's other stuff. You can hardly expect to dominate the other team on your first run at any PvP game and mush is no different.

In this instance it looks like your mush team did a great job hiding, causing the humans go after the wrong people. Better yet, they could have socially engineered it directly, which IMO is the beauty of the game.

On january 1, 2015
[7950824]
Kenik13

Impet
But I seem to recall that Guy had solid and paranoid. So he was on at least one ship before that one. Also Andie killed me? I knew he hit me at least once, but he delivered the final blow? Not expected.


Oh, I didn't mean that Gioele was one of the other newbies. But your ship had a few tutorial players, you can check that in the endpage, if a player finishes a tutorial that ship, there's an indication in the action history. It seems actions are weighted; for example finishing research can show up, but does not always; finding planets or fixing stuff, or hitting people the same. But some things, like finding the talkie and killing someone, that always or almost always seems to appear, so you can figure out who killed who for sure, and you can figure out who did the tutorial that ship for sure too.

On january 1, 2015
npfan
ImpetHaven't you noticed you could leave longer messages when you were high in the rankings than when you were low in the rankings, of glory for the ship?

It's not really a difference in character limits; it's more the result of bad formatting. For people at the lower end of the glory rankings, long last words get cut off because a foreground image starts covering up the last words after a few lines. You would have to view the source code to see the rest of the last words.
On january 1, 2015

Then I gave up hope, ran to refectory ate, ran back did two research because I wanted to see the numbers next to shield grow. On january 1, 2015
[1820396]
npfanIt's not really a difference in character limits; it's more the result of bad formatting. For people at the lower end of the glory rankings, long last words get cut off because a foreground image starts covering up the last words after a few lines. You would have to view the source code to see the rest of the last words.

Or you can just highlight whole last-words paragraph down to that little icon below that, use CTRL+C and then CTRL+V it into some text window or editor. Voila, whole last words visible. I do it pretty often.

I mean that there were few games when Paola was Mush, but it was the games when I'm early killed, or the first time when I was newbie and didn't know about the game, or one time when she was inactive, so I knew nothing about Mush Paola, but it was my 3rd time, 2nd time a row as Paola becoming Mush.

Anyway, Eleesha did her work well. She killed Janice because she noticed her lack AP. I was careful with rations, tried to eat them while saving AP. I was hidden 8 days. I couldn't be hidden anymore, why? Eleesha printed the LIST on 7th day. Raluca or me? I didn't know the answer, Eleesha played well. I gave her some advices which doesn't hurt me. I also adviced her to make free slot, but she didn't close the tab once she got online again. On january 20, 2015
NERON

My only intent was to create enough so we would have minimal problems should fires destroy the post-it block + half the stack. I've had it happen a few times on the really long ships and we ended up having to waste AP porting plastic scraps from ABII instead. It was purely for gameplay purposes

I also think it's much cleaner than having each person make a new post-it and dropping it in IB after expos, making a pile of unstackble post-its on the shelf
On january 20, 2015
[6826491]

I understand the intent, but it's still a bit excessive. A few dozen identical ones (say, under 40, preferably) would have been a bit more reasonable, for future reference. At that point, you could leave the block in another room, such as the Lab, if someone active can't be trusted to keep it in their inventory until it's needed again. If you were to lose all the notes AND the block at that point, you'd probably have bigger problems to worry about.
On january 21, 2015
[7950824]

Remember most ships that collect scrap end up with a lot of plastic scrap that cannot be used for blueprints or anything else really - that can be carried as 'item loss' fodder without risking getting destroyed by fires.

Weapons and mycoalarms after the mush are (believed) gone, unless your ship is really into 'recycling' and can throw the repair points or AP to dismantle into breaking them down, are also inventory fillers that fire cannot destroy and will never be used again (If you're right about the mush).

Many ships don't use the protective gloves much or at all; additionally if the white flag is not made the old T-shirt can be taken on expos. Succeeding in getting the Kube lost or stolen on an expo should be worth an achievement in my thinking...

There's also the least useful pills and the research and commander manuals, as well as blueprints that were not built, all of which could be destroyed by fire, but if not can be used as filler if the block of notes was destroyed. In extremis, if the ship has loads of fuel or O2, those can be used to fill the inventory, despite the difficulty in being unable to just drop them.

On january 30, 2015
NERON

Trail Minimizer is not "bugged". It simply doesn't work as intended like GPU and screws up your ship more than it helps. It's been tested.
On january 30, 2015
Kyubey

Well, TM can be useful in the way it works now - but it really limits it's usefulness. Still in situation TM/Radar/Defective Piston Sensors TM would be ok.
On january 30, 2015
[6826491]
NERONTrail Minimizer is not "bugged". It simply doesn't work as intended like GPU and screws up your ship more than it helps. It's been tested.

Yep. It doesn't make the ships you move away from "disappear", as one might think it does. Hunters that aren't destroyed will catch up to the ship eventually, leading to progressively larger waves. I experienced this on a ship that went from waves consisted of 33 and 36 hunters on D8, to waves with 38+ hunters per wave on D9 and D10. The wave that killed us was 46 hunters, on D10. Each of these were new waves, and we were running as soon as any Aracks in the wave were eliminated - usually in the same cycle as they arrived.

I'll note that as the sole pilot (and Commander) from around D4 onward, we ran from every encounter after that point. But if TM were indeed working as intended, then those D8-D10 waves wouldn't look like D15+ waves.

The problem here isn't so much when you have a lot of active pilots, and you're destroying most or all of the early waves. TM can actually work well on a ship like that, because the ones that catch up to you (prior to say, D15) probably won't be overwhelming in number. If you lack pilots, and you're thinking you're better off running, you might see it as a sense of security, and those hunters will eventually come back to haunt you.
On january 30, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

Trail Minimizer does work as intended, I've tested it dozens of times. When you escape a wave of hunters without TM, only half of them catch up with you after you move. With TM, it's only one quarter. I've seen a wave of 90 hunters reduced to less than 20. TM also reduces the waves that are generated by moving the ship.

Sometimes you can get another random wave, but that's just bad luck.
On january 31, 2015
npfan
NERONTrail Minimizer is not "bugged". It simply doesn't work as intended like GPU and screws up your ship more than it helps. It's been tested.

So far, all I hear is hearsay and so-called evidence against TM and GPU has not yet been demonstrated to be more than just bad RNG. Frankly, I would have to see either a full-fledged null hypothesis test with enough data points or the developers saying something explicitly before I'm convinced TM or GPU backfires in long-term ships.

Spazticus

Yep. It doesn't make the ships you move away from "disappear", as one might think it does. Hunters that aren't destroyed will catch up to the ship eventually, leading to progressively larger waves. I experienced this on a ship that went from waves consisted of 33 and 36 hunters on D8, to waves with 38+ hunters per wave on D9 and D10. The wave that killed us was 46 hunters, on D10. Each of these were new waves, and we were running as soon as any Aracks in the wave were eliminated - usually in the same cycle as they arrived.

I'll note that as the sole pilot (and Commander) from around D4 onward, we ran from every encounter after that point. But if TM were indeed working as intended, then those D8-D10 waves wouldn't look like D15+ waves.

The problem here isn't so much when you have a lot of active pilots, and you're destroying most or all of the early waves. TM can actually work well on a ship like that, because the ones that catch up to you (prior to say, D15) probably won't be overwhelming in number. If you lack pilots, and you're thinking you're better off running, you might see it as a sense of security, and those hunters will eventually come back to haunt you.

I see that more as an argument against moving so much rather than as an argument against TM or an argument for the idea that all standard hunters not destroyed catch up eventually because moving the ship does seem to have a likely chance of generating a new wave.

PeanutzSometimes you can get another random wave, but that's just bad luck.

Exactly.
On january 31, 2015
Saboteur

Based on my experience and observations, both GPU and TM are bugged, I was checking it for example on casting ships.

What GPU does is not "prevent events from happening", as it would seem to in the description but it instead delays when they occur. If you have it trigger a few times in a row, the bad events get delayed and stockpiled for the next cycle, in which they may potentially be delayed again. The next time GPU fails to stop any bad events, you'll have more of them happening at once in that cycle.

The same can be said of TM and hunters. The hunters you think you left behind will just catch up to you in a few cycles, and if you move the ship a lot without killing them, you can end up with 30-40 hunters every new wave, before the end of Day 8 or Day 9.
On january 31, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

What GPU does is not "prevent events from happening", as it would seem to in the description but it instead delays when they occur. If you have it trigger a few times in a row, the bad events get delayed and stockpiled for the next cycle, in which they may potentially be delayed again. The next time GPU fails to stop any bad events, you'll have more of them happening at once in that cycle. That's true, but it's not because of a GPU bug, it's because of the way the game works. The events at cycle change are based on time (the longer the ship lasts, the more events occur), on the crew's activity and on what happened on the previous cycles. If GPU works, nothing happens that cycle, and the RNG takes that "nothing" into account the next cycles. But I think it is still worth it. On the few long ships where we didn't have GPU, I really regretted it. It can be invaluable to have a quiet cycle with no fires, nothing broken, no panick attacks, no injuries, and when everyone can just rest and save up their AP.


The same can be said of TM and hunters. The hunters you think you left behind will just catch up to you in a few cycles, and if you move the ship a lot without killing them, you can end up with 30-40 hunters every new wave, before the end of Day 8 or Day 9. That, on the other hand, isn't true. On average, if the ship doesn't move, you get one wave of hunter every day (sometimes you can get two or three waves, but smaller ; sometimes you get no hunters at all). MT has no influence on that. The number of hunters grows like the number of events, and I'm talking about the number of initial hunters, the ones that appear at random. MT doesn't work on initial hunters, it simply reduces their number if you escape them (they're reduced if you move anyway, even if you don't have MT). The number of hunters the next day will be calculated on the initial wave, not on the ones that caught up with the ship after escaping.

As far as I know, the only thing that makes you get huge wakes is when you have no hunters at all for a day or more. Then you know that your pilots should get a long rest, because the next wave is going to be much bigger.


I also have a theory about moving the ship a lot, not just to escape, but to go to planets. I haven't really verified it yet, but I noticed that on most long ships that did a lot of expeditions to find starmaps, there were always hunters but their numbers appeared to be smaller than on ships that mostly stayed in the same place. I don't think this thread is the place to explain the theory in detail, though.
On january 31, 2015
npfan
PeanutzI also have a theory about moving the ship a lot, not just to escape, but to go to planets. I haven't really verified it yet, but I noticed that on most long ships that did a lot of expeditions to find starmaps, there were always hunters but their numbers appeared to be smaller than on ships that mostly stayed in the same place. I don't think this thread is the place to explain the theory in detail, though.

That's consistent with my experience.
On january 31, 2015
sperbi

Well I was once on a ship where we had at day 4 (mush selection was at beginning of day 3) a wave of 13 hunters and the project trail minimizer, we moved one cycle after that and after moving we got 2 hunter messages and we had 17 hunters. If we hadn't have much pilots the ship would have been doomed already. It seems wrong to me how this whole concept of hunter waves is working and that you can't reduce them by fleeing since it seems that you often trigger new hunter waves.
Why can't you just reduce the hunter waves by moving away since it already needs fuel and aps and not trigger new waves by doing so?
Why does every ship which wants to survive past day 5 need much pilots?
On january 31, 2015
Saboteur
PeanutzThat's true, but it's not because of a GPU bug, it's because of the way the game works. The events at cycle change are based on time (the longer the ship lasts, the more events occur), on the crew's activity and on what happened on the previous cycles. If GPU works, nothing happens that cycle, and the RNG takes that "nothing" into account the next cycles.

Interesting theory but basically that's in agreement with my obseravtions. GPU worked, nothing bad happened but it will because it didn't earlier So GPU is bugged because it didn't prevent bad events from happening (as it says in the description), it instead only delayed them.

PeanutzBut I think it is still worth it. On the few long ships where we didn't have GPU, I really regretted it. It can be invaluable to have a quiet cycle with no fires, nothing broken, no panick attacks, no injuries, and when everyone can just rest and save up their AP.

In my opinion it is isn't. Here is why: without GPU, 3 consecutive cycles, in each you get 3 fires and 1 patroller broken. With GPU: nothing bad happens for 3 cycles, cycle 4 you get 9 fires and 3 patrollers broken. And people are spending AP during these 3 cycles anyway, just on other things, so when it comes to cycle 4, you have lots of fires and broken patrollers, but no AP to take care of everything (or you could move the drone to start repairing patroller earlier). Same goes for events doing damage. Because of GPU, I died few times because of plate, roomshake, electrical shot and losing more than 10HP during one cycle change. Never happened without GPU. If it would be roomshake cycle 1, plate cycle 2 and electical shot cycle 3, I would be able to deal with them. I remember my best ships more or less and this fits perfectly so I awalys strongly discourage crew from working on GPU. Researching it is just risking people lives and putting yourself in situation when you have few calm cycles, but after them, ships is on fire and everything gets broken during one cycle change. Which is a pain in the ass, especially if you are for example preparing for expedition or getting ready to shoot hunters.

About TM I am not 100% sure, didn't check it as closely as GPU, but from my observations on longer ships with and without this project, we had much larger waves with the project than without it. Having waves of 40 hunters about d10 with the project compared to waves of about 20 hunters d10 without it. I tend to believe it wasn't just bad luck or RNG, number of pilots or times of moving the ship. It is obviously hard to take all these factors into consideration and be sure about it, but I have noticed coleration between having TM and bigger waves of hunters.
On january 31, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?
sperbiWell I was once on a ship where we had at day 4 (mush selection was at beginning of day 3) a wave of 13 hunters and the project trail minimizer, we moved one cycle after that and after moving we got 2 hunter messages and we had 17 hunters.

That was just bad luck, nothing to do with TM. It can happen with or without the project.


It seems wrong to me how this whole concept of hunter waves is working and that you can't reduce them by fleeing since it seems that you often trigger new hunter waves.
Why can't you just reduce the hunter waves by moving away since it already needs fuel and aps and not trigger new waves by doing so? You can reduce them by fleeing. That is exactly how the game is designed. If you have 20 hunters and you flee, without TM you get 10 hunters after moving, and with TM you get 5. Getting a second wave of hunters when you flee is random, not due to moving or to TM.

Moving the ship does trigger new waves, but not when you flee, only if you had no hunters at all before moving (that isn't a theory, it is proven).


SaboteurBecause of GPU, I died few times because of plate, roomshake, electrical shot and losing more than 10HP during one cycle change. Never happened without GPU. If it would be roomshake cycle 1, plate cycle 2 and electical shot cycle 3, I would be able to deal with them. I remember my best ships more or less and this fits perfectly so I awalys strongly discourage crew from working on GPU. Researching it is just risking people lives and putting yourself in situation when you have few calm cycles, but after them, ships is on fire and everything gets broken during one cycle change.

I've seen plenty of long ships which did not have GPU and where people got steel plates, room shakes, fires and / or spikes in the same cycle. GPU does not cause that, and in my experience, it doesn't make such a significant difference in the number of events in the following cycles (it does have a slight influence, but not to the point of being a danger). On the longest ships, the pain is having disasters strike every single cycle, without having time to rest. And I've seen GPU save lives, not cost them. Lots of times, after horrible cycles when we didn't have enough AP to heal everyone and were afraid of losing someone to a steel plate at cycle change, GPU gave us the precious respite we needed to save their lives.


About TM I am not 100% sure, didn't check it as closely as GPU, but from my observations on longer ships with and without this project, we had much larger waves with the project than without it. Having waves of 40 hunters about d10 with the project compared to waves of about 20 hunters d10 without it. I tend to believe it wasn't just bad luck or RNG, number of pilots or times of moving the ship. It is obviously hard to take all these factors into consideration and be sure about it, but I have noticed coleration between having TM and bigger waves of hunters. I am 100 % sure : TM does not influence the number of hunters in the initial waves or their appearance. Only one thing has an influence on the frequency of new hunters : moving the ship or not. When you don't move, if you get several waves or no hunters at all, it's because of luck.

What influences the number of initial hunters is, like the events at cycle change (and it's not a theory, that's how it's designed), the length of the ship, the crew's activity (and "reactivity", but that's never been explained properly) and what happened during the previous cycles. That's all.
On january 31, 2015
Saboteur
PeanutzI've seen plenty of long ships which did not have GPU and where people got steel plates, room shakes, fires and / or spikes in the same cycle. GPU does not cause that, and in my experience, it doesn't make such a significant difference in the number of events in the following cycles (it does have a slight influence, but not to the point of being a danger).

Then we have different experiences. Of course I have also seen people got steel plates, room shakes, fires and / or spikes in the same cycle without GPU, but with GPU it was on much, much bigger scale. Especially after GPU triggering 3 or more times in a row.

PeanutzOn the longest ships, the pain is having disasters strike every single cycle, without having time to rest. And I've seen GPU save lives, not cost them. Lots of times, after horrible cycles when we didn't have enough AP to heal everyone and were afraid of losing someone to a steel plate at cycle change, GPU gave us the precious respite we needed to save their lives.

My longest ship was d31, we didn't have GPU. We had crisises, but they were much easier to deal with compared to my d15-d20 ships with GPU. You can obviously say that the crew was more active, we had different projects or that we had luck and nicer RNG I remember we had fires and bad events, but they were spread through cycles, not happening all at the same time. It is easier to deal with bad events during few cycles than if they all happen at once. I have never had such horrible cycles without GPU that I have had with it after it triggered few times in a row. And I'd never say GPU ever saved any life during my ships, it most certainly caused few deaths though (my own included).

Peanutz

I am 100 % sure : TM does not influence the number hunters in the initial waves or their appearance. Only one thing has an influence on the frequency of new hunters : moving the ship or not. When you don't move, if you get several waves or no hunters at all, it's because of luck.

What influences the number of initial hunters is, like the events at cycle change (and it's not a theory, that's how it's designed), the length of the ship, the crew's activity (and "reactivity", but that's never been explained properly) and what happened during the previous cycles. That's all.


I am not saying TM influences the number hunters in the initial waves or their appearance. I am saying that the hunters that were supposed not to follow you because of having TM, are catching the ship up after few cycles anyway, they are not lost forever. They won't show when you reach your destination point but they will eventually. This is how I explain having waves of ~40 hunters around d10 with TM compared to waves of about ~20 hunters around d10 without TM.
On january 31, 2015
Flash

Nice discussion but why don't you make a thread for it? This is the Fail Thread you know

On january 31, 2015
Saboteur

This discussion in this thread is a fail Ok, I outta here, I think I have nothing else to add anyway.
On january 31, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

As you say, different experiences. There is a part of chance in the RNG, it's not just based on time, activity and past events. Some ships have more difficulties with hunters, others with morale or fires or injuries, and there seems to be no rational reason.

A few things can influence the chance of death, though. For example, the individual chances of steel plates is lower if you have a numerous crew still alive. It's the same for panic attacks, except that Mush don't count, so if you have 15 Mush and 1 human, you'd better have a very good shrink with lots of AP. Same thing for hunters, you can influence their number by moving a lot (it generates additional waves, but smaller than the normal ones, and that decreases the number of normal, initial hunters you will get later).

But in my experience (after two d30+ ships and a number of d20+ ships), GPU has always been a huge help, not a danger.


I am saying that the hunters that were supposed not to follow you because of having TM, are catching the ship up after few cycles anyway, they are not lost forever. They won't show when you reach your destination point but they will eventually. This is how I explain having waves of ~40 hunters around d10 with TM compared to waves of about ~20 hunters around d10 without TM. I am positive that it doesn't work like that. Those ships are lost forever. As I said, on average, you only get one wave per day, and that wave is calculated on the initial wave of the day(s) before, not on the waves you had after escaping. If you get other waves the same day, or if you get bigger waves the next day, it is only bad luck. It has nothing to do with TM. Sometimes there is just no explanation. I remember getting 65 hunters on d14, and not more than 30 on d20+ ships, all with TM.

(By the way, everybody talks about TM, but TM isn't what causes the reduction of hunters, it's the fact of moving the ship to flee. The project only increases the effect of an existing game mechanism.)


FlashNice discussion but why don't you make a thread for it? This is the Fail Thread you know

Ahem. No, I didn't say it myself before continuing the discussion. I promise to ban myself if I do it again.

If anyone's interested in talking about all this, there are threads about hunters and difficulty in the Discussion forum (like this one, for example).

On february 13, 2015
NERON

Euanj04[...]Bases show up at the same cycle every day. Once you get the first base, note which cycle it is, it will be the same cycle for the rest of the game. With this knowledge, be sure to :

  • Try to get online asap for the base the cycle it appears
  • Remind the crew not to move that cycle and cycles after in advance, even if you will be online on the cycle but especially if you won't
  • Put other things on hold and save up AP/satisfaction level so you're prepared to contact the base in one cycle once online. Preparing a full bar is not unreasonable and you should eat for it if needed.

Think of it as ... gardening where you need to get online every C8 to treat plants, except it's a different cycle every game.


Anyways, did those guys complain about the bases not being fast enough and discuss whether or not to move at the loss of the signal before actually moving? Because if they didn't, it's also their fault for being n00bs not checking the comms terminal before moving.

If they did notice the lack of base before moving and had to make judgment calls, then well ... being stuck in a zone is extremely frustrating in emergencies or runs at Eden. Even so, they should have made an effort to better explain what you're supposed to do before stabbing anyone. Every crew living member is generating AP for group use, after all

Turns out, the mush tried to kill me, but alas, he accidentally healed me after the first hit. My health after he hit me was at 1 , so anything extra could've killed me. Quite a fail for the mush.

Dzanek

Welp when I am human and investigate I try all I can, but I attract suspicion. When I am Mush I try to be a part of Mush hunt and do it the least suspicious for myself.

Ship 1:
I was Andie, my job was to research. As I was human, I told people to rush MycoAlarms as first. I had got dirty before Mush selection, so I went to Bravo Dorm. To make sure, I picked the Medikit up and check if anybody is wounded. Then dropped the Medikit, picked the Soap up, and washed myself. Then came back to work advancing MycoAlarm and convincing crew to make it. I visited the Bridge as well, and noticed that there's Medic Mage Book. I took it to the Medlab and told Chun. I was telling Chun about advantages of this Mage Book, asking who could read it, about my intention to get Devoted skill and rush this research. He read it without talking anything, she closed the tab, saying nothing. Then I got her back to my PM and asked for help in research. She promised to be back in 2 cycles. And in this promised cycle I noticed that Chun had been there 3 minutes before. I refilled my AP to full and just waited to out 1 and another half of research. I could do it. I tried to contact Chun, but she didn't answer. Then... Stephen, who was proven human via illness, killed me... I saw no relay, nobody had informed me about relaying research, and Stephen told that he didn't see research advances. And no mission from Jin Su... Welp, I had full AP, and could do 1,5 research, but as I am killed and last biologist, I wished good luck crew.

Ship 2:
I was Kuan Ti, being picked as Mush. I made a good job making spores, stealthing Alpha Dorm shower and dismantling it, staying clear no visiting Bravo Dorm nobody would suspect that I could convert people. And morale was bad for crew, Janice was staying in Bravo Dorm, Jin Su was gold and had free slots, but didn't want to pick Leader. And it was good way to trick Eleesha and accuse them of being Mush. Nobody suspected me, and I could spike people. Plasma Shield? I rushed it! And enjoying to be in good position, I noticed that my partner was active just once per day. 18 hours of waiting, and 3 pieces of anti-Mush research were done. I thought my partner would go rampage. As I was afraid that he could go transfer without closing PM, I told him that if he went rampage, he shouldn't reveal me in it. But it seems that he didn't understand. He attracted suspicion, Eleesha told me about him. And he used this awful Transfer skill and didn't even know about this PM. Why? Nobody imagined me as Mush, but my partner broke this all. As transfer target was a newbie, I didn't go rampage, but try some talking with the transfer target. My partner got caught because he used Green Slime under camera... and got killed very quickly. I went sleeping and in the next day, 8 cycles after the transfer, I'm still alive. What do I notice? Transferred target was active 17 hours ago, she was asking if whole the private conservation is carried on with Mush partner. Eleesha wanted her to show it. And 5 hours ago Eleesha closed the tab with me. I knew that Eleesha would kill me as soon as she refills AP. We got a fire but it's been extinguished. So Eleesha found the Extinguisher. I could just rampage, she knew I was Mush. I thought she was on the Bridge, but she was in the Bravo Dorm, there were 5 people, and Ian on the Bridge. Good room to use some grenades. I got lucky finding corridor and I found the Grenade. I used it in the Bravo Dorm and killed Eleesha. Blaster on the shelf and a pair of lenses... and armor as well... Yeah, I took the armor and 2 capsules of oxygen, leaving just 1 unit of oxygen in the tank, and crew started suffocating, and depressing... I hid behind Ian, but Roland got the knife and killed me... only if my Mush partner closed this PM or didn't use the useless transfer... At least Eleesha warned me and proved me that she'd attempt to kill me, when she closed the tab. And this crew is going to die.

On march 17, 2015
[6306959]

This happened to me not so long ago, on my very first game on the English server.

I wake up as Kuan Ti (first time ever I played Kuan Ti), only to find 11 people inactive in lab. Only active people besides me are Terrence, Derek, Hua and a very silent Ian. After a chat with a very level-headed Derek, we figure out that we have a case of multi-account and can only hope the Mush is among them.

Then, guess what ? Terrence is alpha Mush, and start slaughtering everyone in lab. Within two cycles our Morale is in shambles, Hua and Ian don't talk. With Derek, we decide to take down the Mush before dying of Morale.

We coordinate our action very precisely. I'm low on AP and Morale, but I'm commander (yes, Kuan Ti commander at day 1, that's how ba we had it) so I stay in Medlab with weapons and the cat, and give Derek a mission to come over so that I can give them to him.

We calculate that he can come in right after midnight with full AP, and that if I pet the cat right before day change I'll make it alive to Day 2 in order to give Derek another mission, which should be enough for him to kill Terrence. After that, a supposedly human Hua could become commander and together they could deal with Ian (believed to be the remaining Mush).

I was pretty proud of myself at this point and had serious hope of at least achieving a Mush-free ship before general depression. Then comes next cycle...and I die. I had forgotten that cycle changes are offset by an hour compared to cycle change on the French server, and as a consequence I died one cycle earlier than expected. Fail.

For the record, Derek did get Terrence, but died shortly after, and commander title went to Hua who turned out to be Mush. Apparently our silent Ian somehow managed to kill Hua, then died of depression.

It was a short-lived ship.

The gold humans on the other side will still choose their 4 skills and some of maybe also stay in Bdorm, at least some of them (there are 3 beds, of course they will be used).

To be honest, experience is needed. If you want to be Mush hunter, you have to be Mush at first, to know how to work on both sides. As Mush you learn how to make excuse and which moves are allowed, and when you're human you know what the Mush would do and what not. When you kill first Mush in 3 hours, the second Mush will be informed and when in the same ship somebody often gets dirty because of repairs and rations, but it looks experience silver man, this man isn't Mush because since I killed the first one in few hours, the second Mush will act much more careful, not so clumsy.
I know how to mark people as human, I don't respect the rule "the newbie the Mush" because his partner would learn him how to play, but if his partner is inactive or newbie as well, they'll get caught sooner or later. I don't count AP of each person, I just use the psychology tactic: "I am Mush, I have partner, people don't know I am Mush, how to win" and much more.

On april 11, 2015
Nihil

Another fail I suffered from was when I was still a Noob and playing as Stephen
Bit of a long story.
I went into the Neron core and decided to help with the nexus projects since I had plenty of AP "Hmm" I thought "These guys have plasma shields up to 40% but this Pneumatic Distributor sounds pretty good too, and I can finish it pretty quickly" (Little did I know that rushing another project was sabotage because it cancels out the other two projects and all progress made on it). After I finished getting the Pneumatic Distributor up to like 70% I went to Bravo Dorm with a sense of satisfaction and a job well done.

Cut to later when I noticed that I was being attacked and lost a lot of health from Roland, he beat the crap out of me and he somehow pulled out my tounge with just his fists. This cut me off from the rest of the world and I couldn't understand what anyone was saying. I quickly grabbed the block of post it notes in the dorm and ran around the ship writing and dropping messages like "HELP ROLAND RIPPED OUT MY TOUNGE AND IS HUNTING ME, I'LL BE AT THE REFRACTORY, SAVE ME", I kept doing this, but I noticed that as I was running around the map, Roland's pink blip was also moving. He was still following me!!!! And once I made a full circle around the ship I noticed that he was reading (and I think destroying) my post it notes. And that meant he would wait for me in the Refractory. Then I decided to outsmart him. I ran out of Ap and Mp but reached the Neron core. Then I waited.

Cut to Hua finding me here later and reading a post it note I dropped in the core, she created a private channel asked me if I really couldn't speak, but I still couldn't respond. And I dropped my block of notes in another room. She ended up finishing me off. Then I was finally able to understand what I did wrong. Someone announced what I did and Chun agreed on it. Hua found me and read my note, then questioned Chun about it. And apparently they thought I was faking that I lost my tounge becuase you would need a knife for that to happen, and Chun had the only knife.

After that experience I started consulting the wiki more often before I did something, and I've gotten better.
I guess you can that I learned the hard way on how to play Mush.
http://mush.twinoid.com/theEnd/5871
My comment was pretty cynical and filled with loathing at the time

On april 11, 2015
Kenik

Post zeven hundred is something I found on the ship I'm on, this is an ongoing conversation but pretty much everything you need to know is here.


NERON : Dear friends, Chao has left us to go to a better place (Bled Out). Do you want rid of him? I can arrange that, I simply have to open the bay doors. Hmmmm? ~6h

Jin Su : I killed him at BD. Thought he was a mush (he was dirty and stayed dirty for some time, I wasn't sure about his AP spending as well). Welp, guess what - he wasn't Gonna eat twice at the lab now, yeah I know not cool but I don't wanna be murdered by you. Knife is dropped at BD btw ~6h

Jin Su : so before you think I'm a mush - just ate at the Lab, anyone can check this (or, well, Chun can confirm this since she's there). ~5h

Raluca : Did you at least get the go ahead from Chun? Because it's still misconduct if you don't have her back, or irrefutable evidence. Although a couple other people at your back is a good move too. ~5h

Raluca : * her AT YOUR back, sorry I'm operating on weird sleep. ~5h

Finola : Even if not Chun, did you at least talk with somebody? Your reasons ... kind of just point to random murder. Taking a mush test after doesn't take that away. ~3h

Jin Su : yep I talked to Chun and several others. I won't kill people randomly. I mean I'm not killing people for just becoming dirty (even though his reason was silly and he's not newbie), but being dirty for long amount of time must be punished. He could easily produce a lot of spores during that time and we can't control that. (E.g. I didn't kill you even though you could use apron for your surgery and thus avoid becoming dirty as well btw) ~3h

Finola : I agree there must be a punishment. Execution is not a punishment. ~3h

Raluca : Sporing in front of people, or a camera produces obvious text. Unless he spent that load of time in the halls instead of under a camera that's a crummy reason to kill. You should have at least two reasons, or an irrefutable one. Still I've seen veterans at the game make worse mistakes. ~3h

Chun : For the record, and not to discredit Jin Su, but I never weighed in on this. Earlier in the game I mentioned he was dirty in the laboratory and that was it. Jun Su sent me a message 8 hours ago asking if he should kill him but I was sleeping and never responded. ~1h

Jin Su : wut? of course I assume mush would spore outside of rooms with crew/cameras You don't need to spend lots of time in halls, it takes 2 second to extract it. And 2 more on yuor way back, for example. ~1h

Jin Su : yeah, and I also thought taht getting dirty is OKish. But staying dirty is not OK at all. It's really suspicious, I mean, isn't taht obvious? ~1h

Raluca : My question was did he leave often during those circumstances. ~1h

Finola : Ok, who did you discuss this with then Jin Su? A discussion involving people agreeing with you killing and sharing your sentiments on a serious level. 47min

Chun : Jin Su did eat twice in Laboratory. Just to note. 47min

Chun : So I personally think worst case he made a bad play as a human. 46min

Finola : I know he is human for sure, the question is more about SDF sanctions. 44min

Raluca : He mentioned it in a chat with me, but acted before I could reply. 41min

Jin Su : show me what rules did I break? There're no rules like that. There's a rule you can't kill people randomly (which is just griefing), but I don't need to consulate or wait for agreement with any member of a ship. If I have my own thoughts why he might be a mush - I can go and straight kill him. I was wrong this time, sure. But I don't think that's my mistake. That's his mistake to 1) not putting on apron 2) staying dirty. In my opinion rather expirienced palyer must know that's very suspicious and inacceptable for a human. 37min

Finola : You can go straight and kill him, but there was no need to with that paltry theory and you had no reason not to wait for a reply for others. Also killing without compelling evidence is an SDF crime. That evidence was by no means compelling. 34min

Finola : I do wish to point out its not like I'm planning on reporting over something so stupid, but talking things out like this helps to hammer home how it was a bad call. 31min

Jin Su : well I wasn't thinking you're gonna report me anyway, but I'm ok even if it happens anyway cause I'm sure (as I said) I didn't break a single rule of a game. Please tell me what rule is it (I'm not making a joke here, I really want to know if there's something against rules in my behaviour. Cuase I think haveing your own reasons to kill someone is enough to kill someone in this game) 21min

Raluca : Being dirty at a suspect time, and being dirty for an extended time are different evidence items. You need something outside those to have a three point evidence. Which is the minimum to not get a chiding. 20min

Jin Su : pff what about AP spending? And what's the rule about "3 point evidence"? I mean is it something existing (written) in the game rules? (I know of 2 posts on forum about rules which is kinda confusing btw, still may be I miss somethign) 17min

Raluca : And no, your own reasons aren't enough, imagine how Chao must feel, getting killed because he fell asleep or just couldn't stay clean. Additionally getting the apron all the time is impractical. So it's an iffy point. 17min

Raluca : 3 point evidence is to keep people from calling you an idiot Not to avoid an SDF call. 16min

Jin Su : what? all the time? He researched w/o apron! And apron was just lying at the lab. I'm playing castings and this is just 100% reason for a kill straight away there. I know publics must be much less strict about stuff like this, but I had other reasons as I said... And please I'm asking you again show me exact rules if possible, thanks in advance 15min

Jin Su : ah, I'm completely ok with being an idiot in other people's mind The only thing I'm following is SDF rules 14min

Raluca : Yeah forgetting the apron is a thing, but a believable thing. Still you killed him without compelling evidence which as previously stated is an offense. 11min

Raluca : Compelling evidence would be a pile of three, four, or more particularly suspect things. Or two or more of impossible mistakes like uninstalling a dorm camera or janice taking off in a fighter, or anything that ONLY a mush could do. 7min

Jin Su : so... what? Ok I agree this is offensive, but that's how it should be if I think the character might be a mush. I can see nothing out of the rules here. I can also clarly see you don't like my point of view but hey, people play this game in different ways (just as we can have dirrefent points of view on life, religion, politics etc), so as far as it's inside game rules it's ok 7min

Jin Su : if there's no rule about that - that's just your opinion. I have another opinion. That's it. If there's such a rule - show it to me, I'll admit I'm wrong 5min

Raluca : Okay, to clarify tell us EVERYTHING that lead to the decision to kill Chao. I need to see this from your point of view before I can explain your idiocy.

Jin Su : I'm totally ok with being idiot w/o an explaination for that I already stated 3 reasons (there are more, but they're minor) and I have no wish to repeat that, actually repeating is what would really make an idiot of me All I want to say is that even a single reason might be enough for me in some cases. Here I got even more. I'm not saying he was a 100% - nothing like that, I'm saying that's enough for me so I went and killed him. No hard feelings, no outside-of-a-game offense, just buisiness (errr, I meant "just game" ) 4min

Paola : My opinion is that you don't kill a man unless you are 100% sure he is mush. 3min

Paola : Although, Chao should have been more careful. I don't wonder he is dead. 1min

Jin Su : well, as I can see so far there're a lot of people with the same opinion. Which is good, I'm not against it, I'm for pluralism of opinions, the more the better. But my opinion differs form yours, as you can see.


Should I report this guy?

On april 11, 2015
[1820396]
Kenik13Should I report this guy?

You should ask rather here.

But whenever you feel, that rules COULD have been broken, feel free to report away. No judge will tell you straight away and for sure that the person will be sanctioned - we need to see logs and other conversations to make a clear picture - but unless your reports are absolutely unfounded, the "worse" thing that can happen is that the guy will be cleared.

On the other hand, from this conversation it doesn't appear like Jin Su had any malicious intents or was trying to grief in any way. And reports should be used rather for cases when you feel that the person tried to work against one's team, create a negative environment or acted rather selfishly or too recklessly, not for genuine mistakes.

In the end, it's mostly up to your own feelings. Do you feel like he deserves to be reported and potentially sanctioned for this?
On april 11, 2015
Kenik

He has since asked to be reported if what he did is against the rules.

I cite this : Mush Tests updated Jan 29/14
While Mush tests are allowed it is not just to kill someone who refuses to take one. The player might not have AP, might not want to be sick if the test would make them so or the player might just not want to partake in the test because they don't like them. Refusing to do the test alone is not a valid reason to kill someone. If this is the only evidence you have that someone is Mush, it's not enough and could be seen as an unjustified killing which will net a sanction.

Chao gave us some reckless play. Jin Su did too. Now we'll see who did worse. I have reported him since otherwise people might die for stupid reasons, a slap to the face is sometimes sadly necessary to learn.
On april 11, 2015
npfan

Whoever is on your ship needs to know they're wrong about a few things about the rules:

1. You don't need 'compelling' reason, you just need some reason to believe someone could be Mush and not someone acting a way a typical human would.

2. There is no 3-point evidence standard when sanctions are concerned. There is no quantitative basis.

3. There is no requirement for consultation. A single person who, at least from his or her point of view, has enough evidence to believe someone could be Mush may legally kill said person without talking to anyone about it. However, it is in the person's interest to explain his reasoning somewhere to help build his case, or some judges may perceive unexplained actions as griefing.

Now, I'm not saying Jin Su is innocent since I don't know all the facts. I'm just saying I have seen nothing so far to make me think he broke any rules.
On april 11, 2015

However riling up most of the crew in the way you callously disregard your own failure is the thing that seems to be getting to the crew.

But... different folks different strokes. He took a roll of the dice without getting a good gauge on his crew and that is the true problem.

Nihil

Another fail I suffered from was when I was still a Noob and playing as Stephen
Bit of a long story.
I went into the Neron core and decided to help with the nexus projects since I had plenty of AP "Hmm" I thought "These guys have plasma shields up to 40% but this Pneumatic Distributor sounds pretty good too, and I can finish it pretty quickly" (Little did I know that rushing another project was sabotage because it cancels out the other two projects and all progress made on it). After I finished getting the Pneumatic Distributor up to like 70% I went to Bravo Dorm with a sense of satisfaction and a job well done.

Cut to later when I noticed that I was being attacked and lost a lot of health from Roland, he beat the crap out of me and he somehow pulled out my tounge with just his fists. This cut me off from the rest of the world and I couldn't understand what anyone was saying. I quickly grabbed the block of post it notes in the dorm and ran around the ship writing and dropping messages like "HELP ROLAND RIPPED OUT MY TOUNGE AND IS HUNTING ME, I'LL BE AT THE REFRACTORY, SAVE ME", I kept doing this, but I noticed that as I was running around the map, Roland's pink blip was also moving. He was still following me!!!! And once I made a full circle around the ship I noticed that he was reading (and I think destroying) my post it notes. And that meant he would wait for me in the Refractory. Then I decided to outsmart him. I ran out of Ap and Mp but reached the Neron core. Then I waited.

Cut to Hua finding me here later and reading a post it note I dropped in the core, she created a private channel asked me if I really couldn't speak, but I still couldn't respond. And I dropped my block of notes in another room. She ended up finishing me off. Then I was finally able to understand what I did wrong. Someone announced what I did and Chun agreed on it. Hua found me and read my note, then questioned Chun about it. And apparently they thought I was faking that I lost my tounge becuase you would need a knife for that to happen, and Chun had the only knife.

After that experience I started consulting the wiki more often before I did something, and I've gotten better.
I guess you can that I learned the hard way on how to play Mush.
http://mush.twinoid.com/theEnd/5871
My comment was pretty cynical and filled with loathing at the time

On april 14, 2015
[8281990]

As a mush doing its best to appear human, I thought I'd finally found my opening: it looked feasible to remove all existing pilots and techs in a solo rampage.

I knew we had a tech book squirreled away somewhere so it wasn't as airtight a plan as I'd have liked, but hoped that limited time/AP would become enemies to the humans at that point. We were in orbit around a non-O2 planet, O2 was getting close to critical, and a decent hunter wave was chilling outside. With a solo tech, you still need at least a couple relay sessions to complete PILGRED, and Aracks were going to start appearing in the hunter waves soon.

The plan hinged on me killing the first target on my own, then transferring into inactive Chao (thus losing my body as a pilot/tech) and going Wrestler all over the place. I had three targets in total: ideal scenario would have them all die, but 2/3 certainly needed to die for any chance of longterm success. (I was fine leaving pilot Frieda up if I had to, since solo pilots can only do so much.) With Wrestler Chao and a yummy spore or two it should have been more than possible.

Chao had a broken finger. Between that and a few whiffs, I couldn't even kill target #2. The next day they'd killed my inactive partner (made obvious by my tactics) and had PILGRED online.

Kobb

As a mush doing its best to appear human, I thought I'd finally found my opening: it looked feasible to remove all existing pilots and techs in a solo rampage.

I knew we had a tech book squirreled away somewhere so it wasn't as airtight a plan as I'd have liked, but hoped that limited time/AP would become enemies to the humans at that point. We were in orbit around a non-O2 planet, O2 was getting close to critical, and a decent hunter wave was chilling outside. With a solo tech, you still need at least a couple relay sessions to complete PILGRED, and Aracks were going to start appearing in the hunter waves soon.

The plan hinged on me killing the first target on my own, then transferring into inactive Chao (thus losing my body as a pilot/tech) and going Wrestler all over the place. I had three targets in total: ideal scenario would have them all die, but 2/3 certainly needed to die for any chance of longterm success. (I was fine leaving pilot Frieda up if I had to, since solo pilots can only do so much.) With Wrestler Chao and a yummy spore or two it should have been more than possible.

On april 23, 2015
[7950824]

This is a mix of fail and win.... but after some thought I decided here was where this tale belongs.

Where are they now?

A sad thing I noticed, examining the players who reached Eden on our server's D32 ship (http://mush.twinoid.com/theEnd/2492).... It really appears to have consumed the newer players who were part of it.

It was quite some time ago. Their AP thread started about 14 months ago. [AP-MMM3] D32C1 Scenic Route To Eden , so the ship started about 15 months ago. About 5000 ships have finished since that one started.

Of the 11 players who survived to reach Eden, 4 never played Mush again.

FredyC was Ian. His end page comment was friendly, as was his AP post. Sounded like he enjoyed himself, had only played 7 ships before this 32 day ship... but hasn't played mush since.

PhilHarnish was Terrence, this was his 4th ship. He posted to AP, seemed to have enjoyed it... did call it 'exhausting' and was referred to by crewmates as 'a master of organizing'... Never played mush again.

Morkon was Janice. Also his fourth ship. Happy endpage and AP thread comments.... did mention "Now I really need a break" ... It's been quite a break, 14 months and counting.

TheSilence was Chun. It was her second ship. Again, the positive comments on endpage, no post in AP thread.... and like several others, never played again.

Another three only played a few ships after that one:

Brightstream was Kuan. It was his second ship, and he only played 3 others after it.

yamilxd was Roland. That was his 18th ship, he only played 9 after it.

DarthSimian was Finola, this was his 15th ships, and he played only 5 ships since that one.

Four players, though 'relatively' new before that ship (considering many of us have played nearly 100 ships now), have gone on to stay highly active Mush players.

lp91, 18th ship, has played often since.

Saboteur, 14th ship, has played often since.

Rain, 20th ship, has played often since.

Coraxes 23rd ship, has played often since.

One difference I notice, between the players who still play, and those who stopped - all four of the frequent players from this ship are in groups and/or castings. Three different sets across those 4 players - doesn't seem to matter which group you take part in.... the group seems to have something to do with retention. Keep up the great work, teams! Keep each other happy, involved, and playing

On april 23, 2015
DarkTheRaven

On april 24, 2015
[1820396]

mmmm, dates...
On april 24, 2015
[7950824]

I'm cool with public (and semi public, and 'just a few know' ) jump dates, myself. I just very, very, very strictly ration my involvement with them. For most people, if you want to jump with me - you can, but it'll be a random jump. For myself, I want to know, to really feel, what is going on with what I consider 'real ships' to be.

That's a bit arrogant. Sure, casting ships are real ships, as are MMM ships, as are somewhat more privately planned jumps.

But if I, and I do mean -me-, if I often jump under 'special circumstances', then.... well. In a sense, I would not know what the normal random ship was like. Since I almost always just jump as soon as I can... I am with whatever players I end up with. I face the same mix that every other random jumper faces.

Sometimes players talk to me (or publicly post to all) about how bad all ships are. About how terrible it is for newbies or how griefers are ruining every ship....

By my endless, randomly timed random jumps (since I usually jump the same cycle my last game ended, from my death or the ship dying or reaching sol), it's totally random. Not the same time of day, not the same day of the week.... across my many ships I believe I'm getting a great sense of what the 'normal' random ship is like. That makes me feel far more comfortable when I respond to a player who insists that things are one way or another, because I'm not insulated, I'm in the same pool of good or bad that everyone else is, so I think I get a pretty clear view over time of what these random ships are like as time passes and things change.

Dzanek

I had a ship where first Mush was newbie enough to infect under camera. Got killed immediately.

Finola made Pheromodem and we worked out that somebody got second spore while direct spiking. Finola couldn't help shouting out that somebody got 2 spores in certain time. The crew said it could be bobby-trap. I noticed that Raluca was active that time. I decided to kill him not being aware that the crew just bluffed to trick Raluca and make a cure for her.
Anyway I killed her, because:
1. Nobody contacted me in private that they were going to make RFS for her.
2. We had technician who could repair PILGRED.
3. Somebody had 2 spores and the spike happened the day before, so at any time we might get third Mush onboard.
We were Mush free. Gioele suddenly went inactive, PILGRED was at 30%. Nobody took care of plants and everybody forgot about broken oxygen tanks (both, although we've got some oxygen on the first planet). As Gioele never woke up since Raluca got killed, we died.
The most funny thing, NERON said that humanity would lose because of no technicians and both showers standing. Peanutz

I think that he knows best what undermines or not what he wants...

Besides, if you look at it the other way, public jumps allow newish players to be sure to play with active, experienced players. There's not better way for a beginner to learn how to play and to see what a good ship looks like.

On april 29, 2015
[7950824]

.... How high of a risk of catching a disease does it need to be for a mush to catch it?
On april 29, 2015
npfan

It has been documented before that if a Mush gets injured and that injury has a chance of contracting a disease, Mush can get a disease that way.
On april 29, 2015
[7950824]

Oh. Razafrazits.
On april 29, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

It's not actually a disease. There are two possible deaths from sepsis : one when you catch sepsis because of failed surgery (that one is an illness that makes you lose 4 per cycle), and one when you have an injury like open-air brain, that causes your death if you're dirty. If used to be bugged, but the bug was fixed recently.
On april 29, 2015
[7950824]

But sepsis is an infection.... and mush are immune to infections? Whaaaaa
On april 29, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

Mush are immune to physiological diseases (the green icon thing), so they can't catch sepsis (as a disease) when they fail surgery.

But death because of dirtiness isn't an illness, it's just a symptom of some injuries.
On april 29, 2015
sperbi

But Impet died of a sepsis, it is even visible in Neron's announcement:

NERON : Death registered : Chao, cause : Sepsis .
On april 29, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mchant ?

As I said above, there are two different kinds of deaths by sepsis. One is death from an illness, that you catch when surgery fails, and that you can heal like all other illnesses (with the medikit, in medlab, sometimes with a pill). The other (from which Impet died) is not an illness but the symptom of an injury.

The death announcement is the same but the cause is not.
On april 29, 2015
sperbi

Oh, I thought it would have been a special Neron message then. well. Good that it isn't bugged anymore ^^ Though I didn't know it would happen at cycle change and not instantly when you are dirty.

A long drawn out mush hunt, first alpha killed on day 2 as he was new and went berzerk. Second mush played the silent game and got away with it up until day 9 where on an expo with a 7% chance of them getting ill... got ill but had no effects.

The whole crew had been working together for 5 days trying to work out which of the 3 remaining unconfirmeds to give the serum and that illness made us certain. Myself and Chun both went to the mush and cured her while she was offline, skills reset, awesome with a full crew bar the one dead mush (No inactives on a random ship).

We celebrated that we were out of danger for a few days till things start breaking down more.
Skip ahead 20 minutes, Death: Kuan Ti - Metal Plate.

He didn't give his HP away and was a relatively quiet but active player.
(ship currently still going, and going well)

Plastic scrap, bad fruit, useless books (like the commander's manual, the lab book or useless magebooks), useless blueprints, old tee-shirt, documents (the two lists), mad kube, genome disk, useless pills... There are dozens of viable substitutes.

Speaking of lost items, nice fail... or rather series of fails on my French casting ship :
- 7 MIA events (fortunately all were found alive)
- 5 Mush traps
- 5 lost items (Babel module, both ropes, post-it, iTrackie)
- 0 starmap fragment in 12 days and at least as many expeditions (probably more)

I think we're cursed.
On may 1, 2015
[1819851]

This is a fail from a ship or two ago;

Roland was an active newbie. In fact he was that rare care kind of newb who asked nice questions like What should I be doing with my ap? He only had sprinter of course but he was doing his best to be helpful. Meanwhile Paola was an experienced player who in chat happened to mention that her last ship only lasted two days before being taken out by mush. Naturally people started asking her how that had happened and Her response went a little like this; Well Roland set a bunch of fires, grabbed both extinguishers and went idling in a patrol craft with them while the ship burned Chao who was standing next to our newbie Roland immediately turned and opened fire on him. Quickly realising his mistake he stopped and apologised. (He then went on to in short order expose and kill a mush with interrogate)

Roland however had received some nasty injuries in Chao's attack, losing his hearing and damaging his hands so all actions take an extra +3 ap. As time went on (we hadn't realised his hands were broken) we wondered we he hadn't fixed himself until it occurred to us that he may not know how. Realising this Paola sent an announcement for him to go to medbay and get fixed up. So he went there where he was met by Raluca who spiked him and transferred into him.

This resulted in a crippled deaf mush trying to rampage with broken hands. But I must say it sure was an effective way of healing our newbie who spearheaded the repair of pilgred and helped get us back to Sol mush free.
On may 1, 2015

This is a fail from a ship or two ago;

Roland was an active newbie. In fact he was that rare care kind of newb who asked nice questions like He only had sprinter of course but he was doing his best to be helpful. Next thing we know Finola basically said; "Finola transferred to me, how dumb." So Jin smacked Hua, Then Chun intervened and said Hua was probably human. Finola died soon after, she was the mush.

One fail from mush was trusting the fake log out of Raluca. One fail from humans was assuming Finola even COULD do a transfer.
One win from humans was Chun stepping in to confirm humanity. One win from mush was using the paranoia of possible transfers to turn humans against each other for any time at all.

This is the thread Raluca used.Raluca : FINOLA IS A MUSH SHE JUST DEMOTIVATOR SPAMMED ME! Be on the lookout for transfer victims. Just in case this was actually a calculated assault.

Raluca : Finola left the room 6min
You have lost 2 . 6min
You have lost 2 . 6min
You have lost 2 . 6min
You have lost 2 . 7min
Finola entered the room 7min
Raluca entered the room 33min ~10h
Chao : Obvious mush. Too bad I was offline. ~2h

Chun followed this up by giving Raluca a nice pill and cat to pet. Raluca seems fine, Hua seems fine. Fun ship.

And the more I am thinking about it, the more stupid it was... (I mean, I had some reasons for my suspicion, but I really could have waited longer before doing anything.) I will try to contact the player as soon as I can, hopefully he won't give up on the game after this experience.

Oh, and don't worry about me wanting to die too much. I try to play by the rules.

On may 3, 2015
[7950824]

You didn't ask for how to get your tongue fixed, and this isn't the questions thread, but I'm going to explain it anyway since you mentioned how you said your tongue is still torn, that suggests you expect that your shipmates are going to fix you - and they probably cannot.

You need surgery. It costs 4 AP. If someone (usually Finola if anyone, it's rarely in a magebook) has the Medic skill, she can do this anywhere by bringing the medkit to you. Otherwise, you need to do it yourself. You have to go to the medlab, you have to lie down, you have to click on the surgery terminal, and select self-surgery. Try to have a lot of AP, if you fail you can give yourself Sepsis; a disease that takes 4 health away every cycle change, it kills you fast... so if you fail you could have a deadly disease and still have a torn tongue.

Good luck!
On may 3, 2015
Carp

Yeah, well, I expected them to fix me because I am currently running around the ship like a madmanwoman with a post-it. I drop it, I pick it up, I drop it again. And occasionally, I start reading it enthusiastically to show my crewmates what they are supposed to do with it. "Help! Torn tongue!" - things could be so easy if they read the message! Unfortunately, this strategy has been unsuccesful so far, so it looks like I will really need to do some DIY surgery. Thanks for wishing me good luck, I'll probably need it.

One more fail, this time concerning the game's logic: Why can't I still communicate via facial expressions/smileys when mute? "" followed by "" would have so much better chances at alarming my crewmates than this stupid post-it.

NERONThis is why you always make the diplomat pick up the compass + important items first

On may 6, 2015
NERON

I also have 900+ cycles of pilot Terrence, who would give the compass to any diplomats so they don't go missing in time for us to fight some mindblenders or skinners without weapons

1) In case of emergencies, launching without pilots will deal damage to the crew on landing but this is still less dangerous than fighting anything except chew-chews without weapons

2) There is usually only one diplomat to many pilots. If you lose one, you can stick another one in IB to pick them up

3) Pilots are only needed for landing. If they MIA in the middle of expo, it's not going to effect the current run and you have some time to organize a rescue crew. If a diplomat goes missing, the expo will go on without them, possibly running into some FUN zones without pause. If your planet is 8 zones or less and nothing catastrophic happens to your expo crew, you will automatically pick up your MIA person at the end, which means no need to re-launch

On may 10, 2015
[8550239]

Isn't there a way to stop two accounts with the same IP joining the same ship?
On may 10, 2015
[6826491]
NGJonIsn't there a way to stop two accounts with the same IP joining the same ship?

That would unfairly punish parents who play Mush with their kids, people in relationships, or friends who live together, etc. The SDF can authorize those people who live together, and might end up on the same ship, but they usually get flagged before that process can happen (or rather, they contact us, because they got flagged.)
On may 10, 2015
[8550239]

How many parent/ kids or partner combos are there really? and they could still play just not on the same ships unless in a casting. it seems fairer than the alternative
On may 10, 2015
Morgaine

Well, my son sometimes plays mush. We have been on one ship together although I do not recall being multi-tagged.
On may 10, 2015
[6826491]
NGJonHow many parent/ kids or partner combos are there really? and they could still play just not on the same ships unless in a casting. it seems fairer than the alternative

There are plenty, and I know this because I see the Mod Inbox on a regular basis. The point here is that what you're asking for doesn't exist, and it's not within my capacity to "fix" that. As it stands, once they get flagged, those accounts can't play again on ANY ship, unless they get authorized to play again.

Also consider that blocking "the same IP" can block a school or library, and subsequently everyone who uses it.
On may 10, 2015
[8550239]

If not isn't a potential libaray/school better than all the players that are getting turned away from playing?

On may 12, 2015
[6826491]
PatrykSzczescieI thought about hacking when somebody told that it's worth if we don't want to have the alien fruit destroyed, but I haven't heard that changing settings before Mush selection is forbidden.

Now, changing it to prevent food destruction is one thing, and I take no issues with that. No judges would, or should.

Turning off the DMZ Peacecore prior to selection is a questionable act, especially when you know that griefers can and will take advantage of that. Is it an act of griefing, on its own? No, but it can easily lead to a griefing situation, and that shouldn't ever be done lightly, just because one person wants to (even if they're the current Neron Admin.) That's a team decision, not an individual one.

I've heard the argument, "well, it you don't have any griefers, it's not a problem." - But that raises the question, "How can YOU be sure you don't have any griefers?" Even if everyone is active and communicative, people can still grief without any warning.

On may 14, 2015

On may 14, 2015
[6826491]
FlashDo you know if Mush can be picked from those characters not yet out of the cryosleeper? That would tell us a lot of how Mush are selected.

Not exactly.... A player can die before the ship fills, and still have been chosen as Mush. That can be due to room events and/or starvation, though suicide is also a possibility (and one that we sanction for heavily.) I strongly suspect that one's Alpha or human status is determined from before a player wakes up.

We've also discovered that a player who is quarantined prior to selection could have been selected for Mush, and although "dead", they won't count as a dead Mush for research purposes.

On may 15, 2015
Kyubey

inactive on cycle change
Expo takes up to 90 min (it can take a bit longer with Sprinter(s) ofc)
If after the launch it will not be back before cycle change, there is no point in launching - better to wait cycle change in beds. It's also less risky, as people in expo can get damage on cycle change, and it's not a thing they want to have, after some accidents.

My friend even used such situation once as mush.
- JS is idle in lab
- Gioele is current commander
Expo is started just before cycle change, mush transfers to idle JS, JS gets title while expo it under way.

I'm mush again. Alpha.

5 times in 10 ships. Gotta start playing Chun. Anyway, that's not why I'm here. Not totally why I'm here. Again.

I'm Roland. Promising ship. Partner rampaged early against... Ian. Pity. Course didn't get any kills.

I pick my moment. Even had a mission. Chao was inactive long enough to have full AP. Kk, I'll kill some with my max AP + mission roland body, then transfer over.

Or will I.

I sure try.

Roland approached Chao in a predatory manner... and spiked them discretely! moments ago

You have earned 1 Glory. moments ago

Chao is dead. Cause: Black Bite moments ago

BBBRRRRIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIINNNNNGGGGG!!!! moments ago

Yep, the dude -died- the instant I spiked him, of -black bite-.

Black Bite Expedition - Illness event
Lose 2 Action Point by the Consume action (any consumable).
Fairly benign, but persistent, the Black Bite is a recent syndrome which nobody knows much about. Every cycle, a 10% chance, loses 1 Action Point

Which.... nobody knows much about, huh?

Like if you get spiked while you have black bite, you instantly die? Really? Always? Who knew?

RNG.... I'd like a FEW WORDS WITH YOU PLEASE.

On may 17, 2015
DarkTheRaven
Bugzilla

If you have black bite, then you lose 4 when someone spikes you. If you die because of that, then you get the unusual death "black bite".

Info on Twinpedia : http://www.twinpedia.com/mush/statuts...

It also works with traps and I assume that it also works if you get a mush trap while exploring a cristalite region, but I haven't tested it.

Keep in mind that's French server, will test it when we manage to launch a ship
